title: Miley Cyrus defends her dating habits and slams slut-shaming after she was filmed kissing Cody Simpson: 'Can't I just have a kiss and açaí bowl?!?!'
text:
Miley Cyrus is defending her dating habits after she was filmed kissing Cody Simpson — in the wake of her splits from Kaitlynn Carter and ex-husband Liam Hemsworth.

"Men (especially successful ones) are RARELY slut shamed. They move on from one beautiful young woman to the next MOST times without consequence," she wrote on Twitter. "If our president can 'grab em by the p---y...' can't I just have a kiss and açaí bowl?!?!"

She also wrote that dating as an adult is new to her, since she and Hemsworth had a 10-year relationship: "PLEASE don't make this awkward for me!"

Cyrus also posted photos of Simpson on her Instagram story: "Australian (my type)," she captioned one.

Visit Insider's homepage for more stories.

Miley Cyrus has launched an impassioned defense of her dating habits after she was filmed kissing Cody Simpson on Thursday.

The 26-year-old star announced her split from ex-husband Liam Hemsworth in August. Shortly after, she appeared to be casually dating Kaitlynn Carter, a blogger and reality TV star — though their relationship reportedly ended two weeks ago.

—The Pop Hub (@ThePopHub) October 4, 2019

"I know the public feels invested in my past relationship because they felt like they saw it thru from the beginning," she wrote on Twitter. "But I am grown now and make choices as an adult knowing the truth/details/reality."

Read more: Miley Cyrus says she never cheated on Liam Hemsworth after news he filed for divorce: 'There are NO secrets to uncover here'

"Men (especially successful ones) are RARELY slut shamed. They move on from one beautiful young woman to the next MOST times without consequence," she continued. "I am just trying to THRIVE/survive in a 'mans' world .... if we can't beat em, join em! If our president can 'grab em by the p---y...' can't I just have a kiss and açaí bowl?!?!"

—Miley Ray Cyrus (@MileyCyrus) October 4, 2019

In a follow-up tweet, Cyrus also wrote that dating as an adult is new to her, since she and Hemsworth met as teenagers and had a 10-year relationship.

"I refuse to recluse and 'date' from home cause A. That's not fun B. extremely uncomfortable / puts me in a vulnerable position," she wrote. "Don't f---ing pity me, not what I'm asking for. I have a great life I wouldn't trade for 'privacy' but PLEASE don't make this awkward for me!"

—Miley Ray Cyrus (@MileyCyrus) October 4, 2019

The "Mother's Daughter" singer also posted photos of Simpson on her Instagram story.

"22, Australian (my type), Abs, Hot Girl Fall" she captioned one, adding check-mark emojis after each line.

Cyrus and Simpson have been friends for years. @mileycyrus/Instagram

She also posted a screenshot of a BuzzFeed writer's reaction to their makeout session.

"After doing my ~research~ on Cody, I can't blame her," BuzzFeed's Terry Carter wrote.

"Thank you," Cyrus wrote, adding the hashtag, "Hot Girl Fall."

Cody Simpson is a 22-year-old Australian pop singer. @mileycyrus/Instagram

Finally, Cyrus posted a collage that underscored her earlier point about double standards: a photo of Cyrus at the center, surrounded by famous men that are typically regarded as "legends," "heartthrobs," or "ladies' men," like Leonardo DiCaprio, George Clooney, and Brad Pitt.

"Legends only," she captioned the photo. She also added the Venus symbol, which is used to represent femininity and women's empowerment.

The collage also included John Mayer and a young Marlon Brando. @mileycyrus/Instagram

For his part, Simpson posted a photo of himself with Cyrus on Saturday morning, calling her "baby."
description: The 26-year-old star recently ended relationships with Kaitlynn Carter and her ex-husband Liam Hemsworth.
